titleStmt.title: Lachrimæ: or lamentations over the dead wherin is described the earnest zeale of the godly, in mourning for the sins of the people, who are dead in trespasses and sinnes. By Nathanael Cannon, minister and preacher of the word at Hurley, in Berkshire.
titleStmt.author: Cannon, Nathanael, 1581 or 2-1664.

publicationStmt.publisher: Imprinted by Felix Kyngston, for William Welby,

notesStmt.note: In three parts: part 1 is "Lacrimæ"; part 2 is "A day of hearing, granted to Sion"; part 3 is "The spring garden or nurserie of spirituall plants".
Reproduction of the original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
